statements: SELECT transaction_id, user_id, amount, transaction_date, status FROM payment_transactions;
SELECT user_id, amount, status, transaction_date, transaction_id FROM payment_transactions;
SELECT transaction_date, user_id, status, amount, transaction_id FROM payment_transactions;
SELECT user_id, status, transaction_date, amount, transaction_id FROM payment_transactions;
SELECT status, transaction_id, user_id, amount, transaction_date FROM payment_transactions;
SELECT * FROM payment_transactions WHERE status = 'success' ORDER BY transaction_date DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT user_id, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM payment_transactions GROUP BY user_id HAVING total_amount > 1000
SELECT * FROM payment_transactions ORDER BY amount ASC, transaction_date DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT transaction_id, amount FROM payment_transactions WHERE amount > 500 ORDER BY amount DESC, transaction_date ASC
SELECT transaction_id, status, COUNT(*) AS num_transactions FROM payment_transactions GROUP BY status HAVING num_transactions >= 2
SELECT * FROM payments;
SELECT payment_id, customer_id, amount FROM payments WHERE customer_id = 100;
SELECT payment_id, amount, payment_date FROM payments WHERE amount > 500;
SELECT * FROM transactions ORDER BY transaction_date DESC;
SELECT transaction_id, transaction_amount, transaction_date FROM transactions WHERE transaction_amount < 1000 ORDER BY transaction_amount ASC;
SELECT * FROM payments WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY payment_date DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT payment_id, customer_id, amount FROM payments WHERE payment_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-31' AND amount < 5000 ORDER BY amount ASC;

SELECT payment_id, customer_id, amount, payment_date FROM payments INNER JOIN transactions ON payments.payment_id = transactions.payment_id WHERE transaction_amount > 2000 ORDER BY payment_date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM payments WHERE customer_id IN (1, 3, 5) AND amount > 500 ORDER BY payment_id ASC;
SELECT customer_id, SUM(amount) AS total_amount_paid FROM payments GROUP BY customer_id HAVING total_amount_paid > 10000 ORDER BY customer_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM payments WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT payment_id, amount FROM payments WHERE amount > 1000;
SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE status = 'completed';
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE phone_number LIKE '+1%';
SELECT payment_id, user_id, payment_date FROM payments ORDER BY payment_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM payments WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY payment_date DESC
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users WHERE user_id = 1
SELECT payment_id, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM payments GROUP BY payment_id HAVING total_amount > 5000
SELECT t.transaction_id, u.username, p.amount FROM transactions t JOIN users u ON t.user_id = u.user_id JOIN payments p ON t.payment_id = p.payment_id
SELECT u.username, p.amount, t.status FROM users u JOIN payments p ON u.user_id = p.user_id JOIN transactions t ON p.payment_id = t.payment_id WHERE t.status = 'Completed'
SELECT * FROM transactions;
SELECT user_id, amount FROM transactions WHERE user_id = 1000;
SELECT payment_id, payment_amount FROM payments ORDER BY payment_amount DESC;
SELECT user_id, username, last_login FROM users WHERE registration_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT index_id, index_name, table_name FROM indexes WHERE creation_date < '2022-05-01';
SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users WHERE registration_date < '2022-01-01' ORDER BY last_login ASC;
SELECT payment_id, transaction_id, payment_amount FROM payments WHERE payment_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT index_name, table_name, indexed_columns FROM indexes WHERE index_id IN (1, 3, 5) ORDER BY creation_date DESC;

SELECT u.username, p.payment_amount, t.amount FROM users u JOIN payments p ON u.user_id = p.user_id JOIN transactions t ON p.transaction_id = t.transaction_id WHERE u.username LIKE 'A%' AND p.payment_amount > 500 ORDER BY t.timestamp ASC;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, name, email FROM users WHERE name = 'John';
SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT id, amount, timestamp FROM payments WHERE amount < 500 ORDER BY amount ASC;
SELECT user_id, count(user_id) AS total_transactions FROM transactions GROUP BY user_id HAVING total_transactions > 5;
SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE amount > 1000;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE email LIKE '%@example.com';
SELECT id, user_id, amount FROM payments ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT users.name, payments.amount FROM users JOIN payments ON users.user_id = payments.user_id;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) AS transaction_count FROM transactions GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY transaction_count DESC;
